name: Introduction to Immunology
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of immunology, including the components of the immune system, the different types of immunity, and the development of immune responses.

name: Cellular and Molecular Biology
description: This course covers the fundamentals of cellular and molecular biology, including cell structure, metabolism, genetics, and gene expression.

name: Microbiology
description: This course covers the fundamentals of microbiology, including bacteria, viruses, and other microorganisms.

name: Molecular Immunology
description: This course covers the molecular basis of immunology, including antigen recognition, immune cell signaling, and immune responses.

name: Immunology Laboratory
description: This course covers laboratory techniques used in immunology, including immunoassays, flow cytometry, and ELISA.

name: Advanced Immunology Topics
description: This course covers advanced topics in immunology, including autoimmunity, immunodeficiency, and immunotherapy.
